page.title: 17Biography Crosthwaite 'area'
page.content: {Reginald Stead MBE.}Mr Stead retired to Crosthwaite in 1971 after 27 years as leader of the{BBC Northern Symphony {Orchestra.}He began playing the violin at his home in Huddersfield at the age of ten,at the request of his father. Later he went to Belgium to study under{Carl Flesch.}For a time he had his own orchestra which played at Colwyn Bay and Whitby.He played in the {"proms"}in London many times and in pioneer tours in Germany with the {Halle Orchestra.}He has played under many famous conductors including{Sir {Adrian Boult,Sir Thomas Beecham}and {Sir Charles Groves.}He sold a rare {Stradivarius violin}to buy his home in Crosthwaite in{1971.}He has continued to play and teach the violin since he retired.In 1983 Mr Stead received the MBE.from{Queen Elizabeth II.}for his services to music.
